HTMLOListElement.summary: The HTMLOListElement interface provides special properties (beyond those defined on the regular interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating ordered list elements.

remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: ol.

HTMLOListElementStart.summary: The start property of the interface indicates starting value of the ordered list, with default value of 1.

remarks.para: It reflects the start attribute of the ol element.

blockquote.para: The start property value is independent of the property; it is always numeric, even when type is letters or Roman numerals.

HTMLOListElementReversed.summary: The reversed property of the interface indicates order of a list.

remarks.para: It reflects the reversed attribute of the ol element.

HTMLOListElementReversed.value: A boolean value. If true, it indicates that the list is a descending list (..., 3, 2, 1).

HTMLOListElementCompact.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The compact property of the interface indicates that spacing between list items should be reduced. The exact handling of the compact attribute is browser-specific. Instead of using this property, consider using CSS line-height instead.

remarks.para: It reflects the compact attribute of the ol element.

HTMLOListElementType.summary: The type property of the interface indicates the kind of marker to be used to display ordered list.

remarks.para: It reflects the type attribute of the ol element.

blockquote.para: The type can be defined in CSS with the list-style-type property. The list-style-type property provides many more values.

HTMLOListElementType.value: A string representing the type.Its possible values are listed in the attribute marker types section.
